You can only get in by car or by bus.

value: - La Llacuna has a lot of beautiful fountains all around. Cuitora's Fountain is one of the most popular, but there are others like Hort's Fountain, Granotes Fountain (Frogg's Fountain) and Pla Novell Fountain. You can walk to all of them along beautiful tracks, about 30 minutes from the main square.
content=A cultural tradition of Catalonia represented by this group for the last 2 years.
, Ball de Diables is a traditional dance of Catalonia, represented by a group of demons with firecrackers.
View of La Llacuna and of its Church of Santa Maria

around: forests and vine fields are of particular interest.

content=Second or third Sunday of December.

La Llacuna is best known for its inlays and meats. There are some shops that send all over Catalonia, to hotels, restaurants and particulars.
La Llacuna has two supermarkets, a kiosk, fishmarket, bakery (with good desserts). A electric material and variety stuff is found in the Major square. 
There is a pharmacy also.
But you can't leave this village without buying some "carquinyolis" from Ca l'Americano, it's a typical dessert, like a cookie.

value: , a monastery situated at the top of a mountain - impressive buildings, great views and good walks around the hill. Try the cable car ride up (althought if you're afraid of heights it's probably best not to!)
